alert.note: Alert for Barnstable; Central Middlesex County; Dukes; Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Nantucket; Northern Bristol; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southeast Middlesex; Southern Bristol; Southern Plymouth; Southern Worcester; Suffolk; Western Essex; Western Franklin; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE TODAY... A strong cold front will result in a line of showers and thunderstorms sweeping across the region today. Some of these storms may become strong to severe producing locally damaging wind gusts. The main time of concern is from 9 am to 1 pm across western Massachusetts and northern Connecticut and between 11 am and 4 pm across eastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island. The main concern today will be the potential for strong to damaging wind gusts. While this potential for this exists across the entire region; the greatest risk will be across eastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island. In addition, dangerous cloud to ground lightning, heavy rain and brief street flooding are also concerns. People with outdoor plans today should monitor the weather closely. Have a plan to seek a safe indoor shelter if threatening weather approaches.
